result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:53 AM Defendant Mario T McKinnie in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Casey Kenealy sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Boese.  Cross examination by Attorney Dorlack.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Dorlack objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Attorney Dorlack is asking for an arraignment date back before the Commissioner.  The Court will set this matter for arraigned back before the Commissioner.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with the co-defendant (Jameco J Wilson) listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

02:17 PM Defendant Mario T McKinnie in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes a discrepency within the body of the complaint stating defendant was previously convicted in Milwaukee County Case 2018CF4969 and Court notes this case does not reflect this defendant.  State indicates the case number should read Milwaukee County case 2018CF4869 and moves to orally amend this.  Court accepts oral amendment but orders an amended complaint be filed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
